intro: Turritis hispidula, commonly known as the rough turritis, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, upright stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered with fine, stiff hairs, contributing to its common name. Turritis hispidula is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and open woods.
